intro: Toxocarpus merrillii, commonly known as the Hawaiian milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white. The plant produces a milky sap, which is a common feature among members of its family. It thrives in coastal and mesic habitats, often found in areas with well-drained soil. Toxocarpus merrillii plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for native pollinators.
